name: The Many Lives of Patrick Warburton Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which 1998 hit sitcom, did Patrick play the love interest of the main female character who only kept him around because she needed furniture moved?
questions.explanation:
Seinfeld.

	For eleven episodes in 1998, Patrick played David Puddy, an auto mechanic turned car salesman who dated Elaine in season six of "Seinfeld". David appeared in the final episode of "Seinfeld" to tell Elaine that he wouldn't wait around for her while she and the others went to prison.

questions.text: Patrick wasn't in the 1995 Disney movie "Toy Story", but he voiced one of the animated characters when they had a spin-off of their character. Which character had their own spin-off?
questions.explanation:
Buzz Lightyear.

	For the "Buzz Lightyear" film, Tim Allen was replaced with Patrick Warburton. Patrick then went on to voice Buzz for twenty episodes of "Buzz Lightyear of Star Command" in 2000. Patrick also did the voice for all the little green men portrayed in the series.

questions.text: In which 1998 television show did Patrick portray a police officer for one episode in a series about three best friends who live together. What was the name of that series?
options: Two Guys, a Girl, and a Pizza Place
questions.explanation:
House Rules.

	"House Rules" aired on NBC in 1998. The show only lasted seven episodes because it was paired against "Two Guys, A Girl, and a Pizza Place" which had a similar premise. Patrick played the police officer boyfriend of Maria Pitillo's character Sophie in the second episode "Sex and Violence". In one hilarious scene, Sophie (Maria Pitillo) shot Dan (Patrick Warburton) and instead of going to the hospital he simply applied betadine to the wound.

questions.text: What character did Patrick voice in the 2007 fairytale movie "Happily N'ever After"?
questions.explanation:
Prince Humperdink.

	Patrick voiced the character of the bumbling Prince Humperdink who didn't get the girl. Mambo was voiced by Andy Dick, Rick was voiced by Freddie Prinze, Jr., the husband of Sarah Michelle Gellar (Ella), and the Wizard was voiced by George Carlin.

questions.text: Patrick played Will Smith's partner in the 1997 movie "Men in Black"?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Patrick played Will Smith's partner, Agent T in the 2002 sequel "Men in Black II". Agent J referred to Agent T as "new and kind of stupid".

questions.text: On "Family Guy", Patrick voiced the character of Joe Swanson, a police officer. From what disability did Patrick's character suffer?
questions.explanation:
Paralysis.

	Patrick first voiced Joe Swanson in the fifth episode of the first season called "A Hero Sits Next Door" which originally aired on May 2, 1999. He was paralyzed after stepping on a skate and falling off the roof.

questions.text: In which state was Patrick born?
questions.explanation:
New Jersey.

	Patrick was born in Paterson, New Jersey, on November 14, 1964. He is the fourth child of actress Barbara Lord and Dr. John Warburton. Patrick has three older siblings...Mary, Lara and Megan.

questions.text: Finish this quote by Patrick "I always wanted to do a ______ movie."
questions.explanation:
Disney.

	Patrick has lent his voice to six Disney movies including "Emperor's New Groove"(released on December 15, 2000), "Home on the Range"(released on April 5, 2004), and "Kronk's New Groove"(released on December 13, 2005).

questions.text: Patrick's scenes were cut from the film "A Mighty Wind", but added to the DVD.
questions.explanation:
True.

	"A Mighty Wind" released on April 16, 2003 starred Eugene Levy, Christopher Guest, and Catherine O'Hara as 60s singers who gathered to memorialize a music promoter.

Orange Coast College.

	While studying Marine Biology at Orange Coast College in Cost Mesa, California, Warburton met his wife, Cathy Jennings. Not long after starting college, Patrick dropped out to pursue a career as a model and actor.
